name: PrimeSpectrum.mk.inj
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝ : CommSemiring R
asIdeal✝ : Ideal R
isPrime✝ : asIdeal✝.IsPrime
asIdeal : Ideal R
isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime
x✝ : Eq { asIdeal := asIdeal✝, isPrime := isPrime✝ } { asIdeal := asIdeal, isPrime := isPrime }
⊢ Eq asIdeal✝ asIdeal
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.

It is naturally endowed with a topology (the Zariski topology),
and a sheaf of commutative rings (see `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.StructureSheaf`).
It is a fundamental building block in algebraic geometry. -/
@[ext]
structure PrimeSpectrum (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] where
  asIdeal : Ideal R
  isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime

name: PrimeSpectrum.ext
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝ : CommSemiring R
x y : PrimeSpectrum R
asIdeal : Eq x.asIdeal y.asIdeal
⊢ Eq x y
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.

It is naturally endowed with a topology (the Zariski topology),
and a sheaf of commutative rings (see `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.StructureSheaf`).
It is a fundamental building block in algebraic geometry. -/
@[ext]
structure PrimeSpectrum (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] where
  asIdeal : Ideal R
  isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime

name: PrimeSpectrum.ext_iff
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝ : CommSemiring R
x y : PrimeSpectrum R
⊢ Iff (Eq x y) (Eq x.asIdeal y.asIdeal)
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.

It is naturally endowed with a topology (the Zariski topology),
and a sheaf of commutative rings (see `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.StructureSheaf`).
It is a fundamental building block in algebraic geometry. -/
@[ext]
structure PrimeSpectrum (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] where
  asIdeal : Ideal R
  isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime

name: PrimeSpectrum.mk.sizeOf_spec
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝¹ : CommSemiring R
inst✝ : SizeOf R
asIdeal : Ideal R
isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime
⊢ Eq (SizeOf.sizeOf { asIdeal := asIdeal, isPrime := isPrime }) (HAdd.hAdd (HAdd.hAdd 1 (SizeOf.sizeOf asIdeal)) (SizeOf.sizeOf isPrime))
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.

It is naturally endowed with a topology (the Zariski topology),
and a sheaf of commutative rings (see `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.StructureSheaf`).
It is a fundamental building block in algebraic geometry. -/
@[ext]
structure PrimeSpectrum (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] where
  asIdeal : Ideal R
  isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime

name: PrimeSpectrum.isPrime
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝ : CommSemiring R
self : PrimeSpectrum R
⊢ self.asIdeal.IsPrime
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.

It is naturally endowed with a topology (the Zariski topology),

structure PrimeSpectrum (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] where

  isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime

name: PrimeSpectrum.mk.injEq
initialProofState:
R : Type u_1
inst✝ : CommSemiring R
asIdeal✝ : Ideal R
isPrime✝ : asIdeal✝.IsPrime
asIdeal : Ideal R
isPrime : asIdeal.IsPrime
⊢ Eq (Eq { asIdeal := asIdeal✝, isPrime := isPrime✝ } { asIdeal := asIdeal, isPrime := isPrime }) (Eq asIdeal✝ asIdeal)
decl:
/-- The prime spectrum of a commutative (semi)ring `R` is the type of all prime ideals of `R`.
